## Programs
## Offered
Our programs equip students with the skills and expertise to excel in their chosen fields, preparing them for a successful and successful professional journey.
## Master of Arts (M.A.) in Education
IMSE has announced the launch of the Master of Arts (M.A.) in Education program from the Fall 2023 academic session. This two-year, full-time program is designed to take students through a process of learning unfolding through discussions, close readings, group projects, and participation in academic activities within and outside the school. The program offers an in-depth knowledge of the complexities of the education sector, closely familiarise them with practice orientation, and introduce them to the classics as well as updated research. The skills acquired in the Master’s program can be useful in the development sector, think tanks, government employment, and academia.
![Master of Arts \(M.A.\) in Education](https://www.mahindrauniversity.edu.in/wp-content/uploads/2023/12/Master-of-Arts-M.A.-in-Education-300x212.webp)
[Learn More](https://www.mahindrauniversity.edu.in/programs/ma-education-program/)
[Apply Now](https://admission.mahindrauniversity.edu.in/)
Ph.D. in  
Education 2024
Ph.D. in Education is an excellent endeavour of the department of education. Being a university dedicated to the ever-changing needs of society, it imparts excellent knowledge through its teaching. This course has a broader scope for doctoral students to undertake descriptive and experimental studies and investigate some crucial problems in education. It suggests suitable remedies and contributes to various academic and administrative practices. It also initiates multiple innovative strategies and methods to improve teaching-learning practices.
The Ph.D. students have to educate themselves through prescribed coursework in the first year. After that, they have to do intense research work, which involves comprehensive examination and research under a Ph.D. adviser. Finally, to earn a Ph.D. degree, the students have to go through phases that involve preparation, facing challenges and difficulties and the final thesis defense. To complete a thesis may take around 3 years.
![Ph.D. in Education 2023](https://mahindrauniversity.edu.in/wp-content/uploads/2023/03/close-up-graduation-certificate-1.webp)
[Learn More](https://mahindrauniversity.edu.in/programs/phd-in-educational-studies/)
[Apply Now](https://admission.mahindrauniversity.edu.in/)

## School of Law
Mahindra University is among the first institutions in the country to transform the way millennials are studying by combining AI and EI to optimize learning in each of its Schools. Mahindra University aims to energize, challenge and shape young minds to help them become “Global Thinkers. Engaged Leaders.
[Apply Now](https://admission.mahindrauniversity.edu.in/)
[Download Brochure](https://www.mahindrauniversity.edu.in/wp-content/uploads/2024/05/SCHOOL-OF-LAW-BROCHURE-2023.pdf)
## Programs
## Offered
Our forward-thinking law program cultivates critical thinking, legal expertise, and strong communication skills, empowering graduates to excel in their chosen legal careers.
## BA.LL.B.
The B.A., LL.B. (Honours) is an undergraduate program with a multi-disciplinary approach that emphasises on the sociological aspects of the law. This program caters to the requirement of the field of law by transforming a student into a socially relevant and professionally adept lawyer for litigation, judiciary, academia, corporate legal consultation, and other areas of legal practice. Besides these areas, this law programs provides a strong background to step into the public service commission.
The students of this integrated course will learn multi-facets of Social Sciences, Economics and core Law subjects. This is a dual degree program in which the first degree has fourteen papers from the Social Sciences and twenty-six core law papers, four clinical papers, eight specialized honors papers and a minimum of five internships. The Social Sciences subjects are Sociology, Political Science, History and Law papers includes Substantive and Procedural law papers, Constitutional Law, Corporate Laws, International Laws and various other laws.
![BA.LLB](https://mahindrauniversity.edu.in/wp-content/uploads/2023/03/Group-117-1.webp)
[Learn More](https://mahindrauniversity.edu.in/programs/ba-llb/)
[Apply Now](https://admission.mahindrauniversity.edu.in/)
## B.B.A. LL.B.
The B.A., LL.B. (Honours) is an undergraduate program with a multi-disciplinary approach with an emphasis on sociological aspects of the law. This program caters to the requirement of the field of law by transforming a student into a socially relevant and professionally adept lawyer for litigation, judiciary, academia, corporate legal consultation, and other areas of legal practice. Besides these areas, this law program provides a strong background to step into the public service commission.
The students of this integrated course will learn various facets of Social Sciences, Economics and core Law subjects. This is a dual degree program in which the first degree has fourteen papers from the Social Sciences and twenty-six core law papers, four clinical papers, eight specialized honors papers and a minimum of five internships. The Social Sciences subjects are Sociology, Political Science, History and Law papers includes Substantive and Procedural law papers, Constitutional Law, Corporate Laws, International Laws and various other laws.
![B.B,A.,LL.B](https://mahindrauniversity.edu.in/wp-content/uploads/2023/03/Group-118.webp)
[Learn More](https://mahindrauniversity.edu.in/programs/bba-llb/)
[Apply Now](https://admission.mahindrauniversity.edu.in/)
## 3-Years LL.B. (Hons.)
Law has never been an isolated profession. It has evolved as a fine thread which is connecting all the professions into one. Be it management, engineering or medical. Law is encompassing every aspect of the economy through its multi-disciplinary and inter-disciplinary approach.
The 3-Years LL.B. (Hons.) Program, offered at Mahindra University from the Academic Year 2022-23, is a post-graduate professional law degree program, which invites interested graduates from all the disciplines.
The Program firmly focuses on experimental and industry-based learning environment. It offers the postulants, an exceptional blend of inter-disciplinary and multi-disciplinary interfaces of learning pedagogy, through the doctrinal and practical understandings of law, along with its social, political, economic and technological aspects.
![3-Years LL.B. \(Hons.\)](https://mahindrauniversity.edu.in/wp-content/uploads/2023/03/Group-133-2.webp)
[Learn More](https://mahindrauniversity.edu.in/programs/3-years-llb-hons/)
[Apply Now](https://admission.mahindrauniversity.edu.in/)
## **B.Tech.-LL.B. (Hons.) *: An Industry-backed Integrated Dual-Degree Program**
In the rapid leaps of the contemporary digital world, where the intersection challenges of legal and technological dominions are mounting beyond imaginations; the School of Law, Mahindra University takes ground-breaking initiative for preparing the Tech-Lawyers for the future, who shall have the best synergy of both the domains viz.
![B.Tech.-LL.B. \(Hons.\) An Industry-backed Integrated Dual-Degree Program-1](https://www.mahindrauniversity.edu.in/wp-content/uploads/2023/03/B.Tech_.-LL.B.-Hons.-An-Industry-backed-Integrated-Dual-Degree-Program-1-scaled.webp)
[Learn More](https://www.mahindrauniversity.edu.in/programs/b-tech-ll-b-hons/)

## Ph.D. in Law
The Doctor of Philosophy Programme (Ph.D.) offered by the Mahindra University’s School of Law (SOL), is strategically aimed at fostering high-quality research that contributes to the creation of new knowledge. Our standards are aligned with international benchmarks, encompassing rigorous processes, assessment criteria, and a commitment to excellence. These Ph.D. regulations draw from the guidelines established by the University Grants Commission (UGC).

## School of Hospitality Management
Mahindra University is among the first institutions in the country to transform the way millennials are studying by combining AI and EI to optimize learning in each of its Schools. Mahindra University aims to energize, challenge and shape young minds to help them become “Global Thinkers. Engaged Leaders.
Mahindra University School of Management aspires to become a leading business school in India by developing ethical, innovative, entrepreneurial, technologically astute, culturally aware and socially conscious managers, leaders and scholars who will make a contribution to the development of the economy and society.

# School of Digital Media and Communication
[Overview](https://mahindrauniversity.edu.in/schools/school-of-media/)
[Courses Offered](https://mahindrauniversity.edu.in/schools/school-of-media/courses-offered/)
## School of Digital Media and Communication
This is the edited version of the same information: The School of Digital Media and Communication taps into new and exciting possibilities in the world of digital media, new forms of journalism, independent media, filmmaking, production and marketing, advertising, Public Relations, digital marketing, and more in the new media environments of convergence and emerging technology. Our students aim to be globally competitive, both in industry and in higher education. To achieve this goal, they learn concepts, professional practices and ethical norms in our state-of-the-art environment.  
The following rigorous, professional and outcome-driven undergraduate degree programs are offered:
  * [3-year Bachelor of Journalism and Mass Communication](https://www.mahindrauniversity.edu.in/programs/ba-journalism-mass-communication-2/)
  * 4-year Bachelor of Journalism and Mass Communication (Hons)
  * [4-year B.Tech in Computation and Media](https://www.mahindrauniversity.edu.in/programs/computation-media/)


The following fully funded residential postgraduate program is offered:
  * [MA in Journalism and Mass Communication](https://www.mahindrauniversity.edu.in/programs/ma-in-journalism-and-mass-communication/)
  * [Ph.D. in Media and Communication](https://www.mahindrauniversity.edu.in/programs/phd-in-media-and-communication/)


The School of Media at Mahindra University aims to be a vibrant hub of creativity, innovation, and limitless possibilities. Students will be encouraged to collaborate on projects that mirror real-world scenarios, allowing them to develop critical thinking, problem-solving, and teamwork skills.
**The school will not just be a place of education but a launchpad for dreams and aspirations. Starting in academic year 2023-24, the School is admitting students to**
  1.     1. **B.Tech. (Computation & Media) and**
    2. **B.A Journalism & Mass Communication.**


**The graduates will emerge as well-rounded individuals equipped with the skills, knowledge, and resilience to make a meaningful impact in the media landscape, shaping the narratives of our world for years to come.**
[Apply Now](https://admission.mahindrauniversity.edu.in/)
## Programs
## Offered
Combining practical experience with a curriculum covering different media disciplines, the School of Digital Media and Communication empowers students to launch careers in diverse media fields. This includes specialties such as journalism, digital media, and communication technology.
## B.Tech (Computation and Media)
The 4-year UG program focuses on application of computing in communication and expression. It is an interdisciplinary program between the School of Digital Media and Communication and the ECSOE’s Department of Computer Science and Engineering.  
Students gain both theoretical and hands-on knowledge of computing while developing an in-depth understanding of visual design, music technology, or the history of media.
![B.Tech \(Computation and Media\)](https://mahindrauniversity.edu.in/wp-content/uploads/2023/05/20230530131630__fpdl.in__laptop-computers-around-world-globe_118047-578_medium-removebg-preview-1.webp)
[Learn More](https://mahindrauniversity.edu.in/programs/computation-media/)
[Apply Now](https://admission.mahindrauniversity.edu.in/)
## Bachelor of Journalism and Mass Communication
The digital economy has unlocked new opportunities for the business world while simultaneously creating new areas of competition in both traditional and new sectors of the economy. Companies are increasingly turning digital in order to cut costs, enhance performance, deliver new products and services and adopt new business models that were not possible before.
![B.A.-Journalism-Mass-Communication](https://www.mahindrauniversity.edu.in/wp-content/uploads/2023/05/B.A.-Journalism-Mass-Communication.png)
[Learn More](https://www.mahindrauniversity.edu.in/programs/ba-journalism-mass-communication-2/)
[Apply Now](https://admission.mahindrauniversity.edu.in/)
## MA in Journalism and Mass Communication
The School of Digital Media and Communication (SDMC) at Mahindra University offers an MA in Journalism and Mass Communication (MJMC) degree to equip its graduates to be righteous, responsible, competent, and globally acceptable. The school shall adopt the highest standards to cultivate and foster these qualities. The MJMC programme is designed as an intensive and rigorous project for the student.
![MA in Journalism and Mass Communication](https://www.mahindrauniversity.edu.in/wp-content/uploads/2023/05/MA-in-Journalism-and-Mass-Communication-course-scaled.webp)
[Learn More](https://www.mahindrauniversity.edu.in/programs/ma-in-journalism-and-mass-communication/)
[Apply Now](https://admission.mahindrauniversity.edu.in/)
## Ph.D. in Media and Communication
The School of Digital Media and Communication at Mahindra University will launch its fully funded doctoral programme leading to the Doctor of Philosophy (Ph.D.) degree in Media and Communication. The first cohort of scholars will be selected for the term beginning August 2024 after a rigorous assessment of their candidature through a multi-step process. Applicants may seek part-time or full-time enrolment.
![phd](https://www.mahindrauniversity.edu.in/wp-content/uploads/2023/02/phd-in-education-3.webp)
[Learn More](https://www.mahindrauniversity.edu.in/programs/phd-in-media-and-communication/)
[Apply Now](https://admission.mahindrauniversity.edu.in/)

# Indira Mahindra School of Education
Overview
[Courses Offered](https://mahindrauniversity.edu.in/schools/indira-mahindra-school-of-education/courses-offered/)
![Indira Mahindra School of Education](https://mahindrauniversity.edu.in/wp-content/uploads/2023/02/group-147.webp)
The Indira Mahindra School of Education (IMSE) at Mahindra University was established in 2021. Named in memory of Ms. Indira Mahindra, who was a teacher (and mother to our Chancellor, Mr. Anand Mahindra and Ms. Anuja Mahindra Sharma, Member Board of Management of Mahindra University), the school aspires to be a center of excellence in educational research, practice, and innovations.  
The School is founded on the understanding that education is at the center of the transformation of not just the individual, but also the society and the nation at large. The development of IMSE since its inception has been guided by a vision to nurture excellence, prioritize research, and create a mark of its own nationally and internationally.
IMSE offers two programs currently, namely, M.A in Education and Ph.D. in Educational Studies. The programs are designed to enable students to take up multiple, challenging career paths. The faculty members of the School bring their expertise in research, institution building, teaching, and training that draws on different disciplines and includes partnerships with academic communities, educational institutions, and civic organizations. As the School expands, it is confident that the synergy of research, teaching and training will become stronger leading to far-reaching impacts.

#### S. Srinivasa Rao
###### Dean of Indira Mahindra School of Education
In a short journey of two and a half years, Mahindra University has marked its presence in the Indian higher education landscape and is emerging as a leading center of multi-disciplinary ideas, research and teaching, preparing future thinkers and leaders for a world that is ever changing, and yet promising. Indira Mahindra School of Education draws spirit and inspiration from this overall vision of the university and prepares itself as an instrument of preparing global thinkers and leaders in educational research, policy, planning, practice and management. It aims to emerge as a centre of excellence in Educational Studies by providing good quality teaching, research, consulting and training facilities to students, researchers, academics, governmental and non-governmental organisations, national and international institutions and other practitioners of education.

####  ![S. Srinivasa Rao](https://mahindrauniversity.edu.in/wp-content/uploads/2023/02/group-148.webp)S. Srinivasa Rao
###### Dean of Indira Mahindra School of Education
**Education is the most powerful weapon which you can use to change the world – Nelson Mandela**
In a short journey of two and a half years, Mahindra University has marked its presence in the Indian higher education landscape and is emerging as a leading center of multi-disciplinary ideas, research and teaching, preparing future thinkers and leaders for a world that is ever changing, and yet promising. Indira Mahindra School of Education draws spirit and inspiration from the overall vision of the university and positions itself as an instrument for developing global thinkers and leaders in educational research, policy, planning, practice and management. It aims to emerge as a centre of excellence in Educational Studies by providing good quality teaching, research, consulting and training facilities to students, researchers, academics, governmental and non-governmental organisations, national and international institutions and other practitioners of education.
Education as a discipline draws hugely from other social sciences and humanities, so it is inevitable that Indira Mahindra School of Education too incorporates other social sciences and humanities alongside core fields of Education in its teaching and research agendas so that it flourishes as a centre for advancement and production of knowledge. The location of Indira Mahindra School of Education within an ambience of synergetic, mutually interacting, multi- disciplinary Schools allows it to usher in as an incubator of new ideas and collaborations. The School seeks to further these goals by inventing new academic programmes which are in sync and, at times, at the frontiers of the overall trends in the country and abroad.
The School has already begun bringing in a pool of very talented and reputed faculty from all over the country, who have made their names in their respective fields of expertise within Educational Studies and who have been trained and taught in well- known and highly ranked institutions nationally and internationally. With their active involvement, the School seeks to build partnerships between itself and the development sector, educational initiatives of the corporates and the government, schools, universities and other institutions, to feed each other with mutually beneficial and field advancing ideas and learnings.
Indira Mahindra School of Education has already launched its Doctoral program, and will be launching its M.A in Education in the academic year 2023-24 and Bachelor degree program in the year 2024-25. The School will be a place to be in if you wish to fly high in the arena of ‘Education’ in India and in South Asia. Hope you come and join us in this mission of creating a world class center of excellence for Educational Studies!
  * **Multidisciplinary Orientation:**  
All programs at IMSE are designed to be multidisciplinary in nature. This also ensures that students of the School have the widest possible exposure regarding issues, frameworks and methods.
  * **Diverse Specializations of the Faculty:**  
Our faculty have been trained in the best universities in India and abroad and have specialization and research interest in multiple areas including Sociology of education, Diversity and education, Education policy, Economics of education, Psychology of education, Educational leadership, Eeacher education, Studies in higher education, Mathematics and science education, History of education and Political economy of education,
  * **Vibrant Academic Ethos:**  
IMSE is committed to creating a culture of participation and collaboration. The School believes that a vibrant academic ethos both inside and outside the classroom is crucial in developing critical thinking among students.
  * **World Class Amenities:**  
IMSE is located on the Mahindra University Campus. It is a residential campus with ample green areas with high-tech smart classrooms, reading rooms, well-equipped and growing library, cafeterias on campus, a medical dispensary and other facilities on the campus itself.


  * **Research Orientation:**  
The curriculum and pedagogy at IMSE are deeply informed and grounded in research. The School makes every effort to integrate the latest scholarship into its courses and classes. The reading materials in each course are updated before the start of every semester to enable incorporation of very recent developments in theoretical, empirical, and practical developments in the field of educational studies. As the School adheres to high scholarly standards, our coursework also includes several useful skills that aid our students.
  * **Diversity:**  
Students at IMSE come from nearly 10 states and from different socio-cultural, economic, and linguistic backgrounds. This diversity enriches the overall atmosphere of the School.
  * **Seminars and Webinars:**  
As part of the core academic activities of the School, IMSE organizes weekly Wednesday Seminars. The seminars held so far have seen guest speakers from TISS, JNU, Delhi University, Calcutta University, NIEPA, Azim Premji University, University of Bayreuth (Germany), University of Hyderabad and other reputed institutions.
  * **Teacher – Student Interaction:**  
Teachers at IMSE encourage and practice close student teacher interactions. Students are always welcomed to have a close interaction with the faculty members and discuss academia and other related aspects. There is close mentoring of students by the faculty.

# School of Management
[Overview](https://mahindrauniversity.edu.in/schools/school-of-management/)
Courses Offered
## School of Management
Mahindra University is among the first institutions in the country to transform the way millennials are studying by combining AI and EI to optimize learning in each of its Schools. Mahindra University aims to energize, challenge and shape young minds to help them become “Global Thinkers. Engaged Leaders”.
Mahindra University School of Management aspires to become a leading business school in India by developing ethical, innovative, entrepreneurial, technologically astute, culturally aware and socially conscious managers, leaders and scholars who will make a contribution to the development of the economy and society.
[Apply Now](https://admission.mahindrauniversity.edu.in/)
[Download Brochure](https://mahindrauniversity.edu.in/wp-content/uploads/2023/04/som-broucher.pdf)
## Programs
## Offered
Combining a rigorous curriculum with industry exposure and mentorship, our program equips students with the tools and confidence to excel in the dynamic field of management, opening doors to fulfilling career paths.
## BBA Applied Economics & Finance
According to the Centre for Economics and Business Research, a think tank based out of the United Kingdom, India is set to become the world’s third-largest economy by 2030, overtaking the U.K. in 2025, Germany in 2027 and Japan in 2030.
[ <https://www.bloombergquint.com/business/india-to-become-5th-largest-economy-in-2025-3rd-largest-by-2030>]
By 2025, one-fifth of the world’s working-age population will be Indian.
![BA in Economics Finance](https://mahindrauniversity.edu.in/wp-content/uploads/2023/03/Group-140-_1_.webp)
[Learn More](https://www.mahindrauniversity.edu.in/programs/ba-bba/bba-applied-economics-finance/)
[Apply Now](https://admission.mahindrauniversity.edu.in/)
## 01
3-week international immersion in Cornell University, Ithaca, NY.
## 02
Specialization in Economics and Finance.
## 03
In the near future, there would be Great demand among the “UNICORN” and “FAANG” of the world.
## 04
Comprehensive business foundations (in finance, accounting, operations, marketing, OBHR, strategy.)
## BBA Digital Technologies
The digital economy has unlocked new opportunities for the business world while simultaneously creating new areas of competition in both traditional and new sectors of the economy. Companies are increasingly turning digital in order to cut costs, enhance performance, deliver new products and services and adopt new business models that were not possible before.
![BBA Digital Technologies](https://mahindrauniversity.edu.in/wp-content/uploads/2023/03/Group-141-2-1.png)
[Learn More](https://mahindrauniversity.edu.in/programs/ba-bba/bba-digital-technologies/)
[Apply Now](https://admission.mahindrauniversity.edu.in/)
## 01
Comprehensive business foundations (in finance, accounting, operations, marketing, OBHR, strategy).
## 02
Specialize in digital business with focus on information systems, digital marketing, ecommerce, and data analytics and visualization.
## 03
3 week international immersion in Cornell University, Ithaca, NY.
## 04
Focused on creating industry-ready graduates who can work in ecommerce, digital marketing, business analysis and technology industries.
## BBA Computational Business Analytics
In terms of employment, the workforce in the analytics companies is employed i) 40% by large organizations (10,000+ employees) such as TCS, Infosys, Wipro, HCL Technologies, Tech Mahindra, IBM Global Services and Accenture, among others, ii) 30% by startup and growth stage companies (1-200 employees) and iii) the remaining 30% by mid-sized companies such as Mu Sigma, Fractal Analytics, Latentview Analytics, etc. The industry added 25,500 fresh graduates as employees in 2019-20, and 41% of the employees in the industry have less than 5 years work experience.
![BBA Computational Business Analytics](https://mahindrauniversity.edu.in/wp-content/uploads/2023/03/Group-143-_1_-_1_.webp)
[Learn More](https://mahindrauniversity.edu.in/programs/ba-bba/bba-computational-business-analytics/)
[Apply Now](https://admission.mahindrauniversity.edu.in/)
## 01
Comprehensive business foundations (in finance, accounting, operations, marketing, OBHR, strategy)
## 02
Specialize in business analytics with skills and tools required to be able to work with data scientists as well senior decision makers.
## 03
3 week international immersion in Cornell University, Ithaca, NY.
## 04
Jointly offered by Mahindra University School of Management and the Ecole Centrale School of Engineering.
## Executive MBA
The Executive Master of Business Administration program is specially designed for working executives with rich experience. The format allows the participants to continue to work while pursuing an intensive, rigorous and enriching program. The format has been tailored to ensure participants from all geographies can come to the campus for classes.
![Executive MBA](https://mahindrauniversity.edu.in/wp-content/uploads/2023/03/Group-144-_1_.webp)
[Learn More](https://mahindrauniversity.edu.in/programs/executive-mba/)
[Apply Now](https://admission.mahindrauniversity.edu.in/)
## 01
Allows you to work full-time.
## 02
2 years duration.
## 03
One residency every 2 months.
## 04
10 residencies of 1-week each.
## 05
Two 1-week International residencies.
## 06
7 hours of teaching per day.
## 07
Extensive classroom-based learning.
## 08
Starts in September.
## BBA Entrepreneurship & Family Business
The BBA Entrepreneurship & Family Business program is designed to cultivate future leaders capable of thriving in both entrepreneurial ventures and established family businesses. It equips the students with essential skills, analytical tools, and real-world experiences by blending theoretical knowledge and practical application. The curriculum focuses on developing abilities in creating business plans, evaluating viability, analyzing case studies, applying business theories, understanding core principles, and remembering key concepts, ultimately preparing students to identify opportunities and navigate the complexities of both new and generational businesses.
![BBA Entrepreneurship & Family Business](https://www.mahindrauniversity.edu.in/wp-content/uploads/2023/03/colleagues-working-together-office-scaled.webp)
[Learn More](https://www.mahindrauniversity.edu.in/programs/bba-entrepreneurship-family-business/)
[Apply Now](https://admission.mahindrauniversity.edu.in/)
## MBA
The ideal student for this MBA program would be a fresh graduate or a young professional. The candidate needs to have a good analytical skill, a curious mind, and the attitude with willingness to learn. This is two-year long, full-time program and is fully residential. Students will have to stay in the university hostels for the entire duration. The unique specializations offered during the second year prepare the students to meet the emerging needs of the industry. Experienced faculty drawn from various disciplines and geographies will teach in the program.
![MBA](https://mahindrauniversity.edu.in/wp-content/uploads/2023/03/Group-145-1-1.webp)
[Learn More](https://mahindrauniversity.edu.in/programs/mba/)
[Apply Now](https://admission.mahindrauniversity.edu.in/)

# École Centrale School of Engineering
Overview
[Courses Offered](https://mahindrauniversity.edu.in/schools/ecole-centrale-school-of-engineering/courses-offered/)
![Rise Of The New Engineer](https://mahindrauniversity.edu.in/wp-content/uploads/2023/02/Group-128-1.webp)
With the core intent of establishing one of the best engineering colleges in India and beyond, Mahindra University École Centrale School of Engineering (MU) was born out of a collaboration between two giants:  
Mahindra Group – a leader of the industrial sector in India, and École Centrale Paris – a 180-year-old institute of eminence, instrumental in the progress of technology.
While Mahindra Group is a multinational organisation worth USD 17.8 billion, and 2,00,000 employees across 100 countries, whose businesses are driven primarily by engineering and technology; École Centrale Paris has been the alma mater to prestigious alumni whose contributions to the world have been pivotal: Gustave Eiffel, and founders of many renowned international organisations like Renault, Peugeot, Dior, Michelin, etc.
Having evolved from such illustrious parentage, MU aims to reach the pinnacle of excellence in engineering education by offering industry-aligned undergraduate B.Tech courses that are globally relevant. With the establishment of Mahindra University, Mahindra École Centrale College of Engineering has been subsumed under the university.
While the college earlier offered 4 Engineering programs (CSE, EEE, Civil, and Mechanical), Mahindra University, housed at the same location, has expanded significantly. It now comprises 7 schools: École Centrale School of Engineering, School of Management, School of Law, Indira Mahindra School of Education, School of Media & School of Design Innovation and recently launched School of Hospitality Management, while offering about 50 UG, PG & Ph.D. programs across different schools.
[Apply Now](https://admission.mahindrauniversity.edu.in/)
![Bishnu P Pal](https://mahindrauniversity.edu.in/wp-content/uploads/2023/02/Group-131-_1_.webp)
#### Bishnu P Pal
###### Dean of École Centrale School of Engineering
A very warm welcome to Mahindra Ecole Centrale School of Engineering (ECSoE). You may be wondering why our name sounds so French! Indeed, we have a vital partnership with the Groupe [des Écoles Centrale](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Centrale_Graduate_School) which, in English, translates to ‘Central Schools Group’. This group, which is globally renowned for excellence in Engineering education, embraces five Institutions in France and three international schools including ECSoE under its umbrella.
Our graduating students, having gone through our rigorous, interdisciplinary research-centric programs that are at-par with international standards at top schools around the world, are expected to be Global Thinkers and Engaged Leaders – in perfect sync with the Rise Philosophy of the Mahindra Group of industries.

####  ![Bishnu P Pal](https://mahindrauniversity.edu.in/wp-content/uploads/2023/02/Group-131-_1_.webp)Bishnu P Pal
###### Dean of École Centrale School of Engineering
A very warm welcome to Mahindra Ecole Centrale School of Engineering (ECSoE). You may be wondering why our name sounds so French! Indeed, we have a vital partnership with the Groupe [des Écoles Centrale](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Centrale_Graduate_School) which, in English, translates to ‘Central Schools Group’. This group, which is globally renowned for excellence in Engineering education, embraces five Institutions in France and three international schools including ECSoE under its umbrella.
Our graduating students, having gone through our rigorous, interdisciplinary research-centric programs that are at-par with international standards at top schools around the world, are expected to be Global Thinkers and Engaged Leaders – in perfect sync with the Rise Philosophy of the Mahindra Group of industries.
We started in mid-2014 as the Mahindra Ecole Centrale college of engineering affiliated to Jawaharlal Nehru Technological University Hyderabad and, since 2020, are now part of the autonomous Mahindra University (MU) in Hyderabad (Telangana, India). Our elite faculty members come with impressive credentials as researchers and are passionate about making MU a reputed research university with strong support from our management for pursuing interdisciplinary initiatives.
We believe that the teaching-learning process in education is most effective and engaging when complemented with unique research experiences of our educators who augment their classroom lectures with cutting-edge applications and emerging technologies in their respective domains. In addition to our core engineering subjects, we also offer carefully curated courses in the liberal arts and firmly believe that this unique symphony between the two contributes immensely towards grooming well-rounded engineers and technologists of the future.
Our Board of Studies comprises an impressive cohort of External Experts from reputed institutions such as the IITs, IISc as also industry leaders. We also encourage our students to develop an entrepreneurial spirit by offering relevant training for developing business models and honing their leadership skills. In fact, words such as ‘interdisciplinary’, ‘innovation’, ‘entrepreneurial mindset’ are heard often on campus! Those motivated to pursue higher education and research careers can access a diverse basket of elective courses in their 3rd and 4th years of study. On an average, over 40% of our students’ secure admission to higher education programs in globally reputed universities in USA and Europe. We are now gradually introducing more and more new, interdisciplinary M.Tech programs, in addition to our existing Ph.D. programs that are at par with similar programs in tier-1 institutions globally. I urge you to visit our website for information and exciting updates about Mahindra University.
We eagerly look forward to hearing from you!

École Centrale  
School of Engineering
MU signifies the ‘Rise of the New Engineer’ – an exemplary paradigm made possible by a historic collaboration involving the Tech Mahindra of the Mahindra Group, École Centrale Paris (now CentraleSupélec) and Jawaharlal Nehru Technological University Hyderabad (JNTUH).

[Download admission notification](https://www.mahindrauniversity.edu.in/wp-content/uploads/2024/05/B.Tech-Admission-Notification-2024-25_Final.pdf)
## Programs
## Offered
By choosing engineering programs, students gain access to cutting-edge research and mentorship opportunities, propelling them towards their goal of becoming impactful engineers.
## B.Tech
École Centrale School of Engineering, Mahindra University (MU) Hyderabad, offers several four-year B.Tech degree, including interdisciplinary programs in engineering education, in partnership with the École Centrale Group of Institutions of France.
These fully residential B.Tech programs are aimed to create engineers with the unique ability to adapt to global engineering challenges and adopt new technologies that would help redefine the future in engineering and technology while at the same time shaping professionals with the ability to master the complexities of multinational organizations.
![b-tech](https://mahindrauniversity.edu.in/wp-content/uploads/2023/02/b-tech.webp)
[Learn More](https://mahindrauniversity.edu.in/programs/b-tech/)
[Apply Now](https://admission.mahindrauniversity.edu.in/)

## M.Tech
École Centrale School of Engineering, Mahindra University (MU) Hyderabad, which has been offering several four-year B.Tech degree programs in engineering since 2014 in partnership with the École Centrale Group of Institutions of France now announces admissions to its interdisciplinary M.Tech programs.
These fully residential M.Tech programs are aimed to create post graduate engineers with the unique ability to adapt to global engineering challenges and adopt new technologies that would help redefine the future, train and prepare Engineers to meet the challenge of interdisciplinary complexities demanded by multinational organizations.

## Ph.D. in Engineering
The Ph.D. in Engineering is a quality course with updated media labs and design thinking laboratories. The Ph.D. students get an excellent opportunity to interact and work closely with the faculty in all interdisciplinary research subjects. The faculty members are the experts in their specialized subjects and can teach the students with utmost excellence. The research infrastructure is of top-notch level, and the laboratories in science and engineering are of high quality. The best part about their research infrastructure is that they are constantly upgraded.

## School of Hospitality Management
Overview
[Courses Offered](https://www.mahindrauniversity.edu.in/schools/school-of-hospitality-management/courses-offered/)
[Academic Partners](https://www.mahindrauniversity.edu.in/schools/school-of-hospitality-management/Academic%20Partners)
In today’s rapidly evolving world, where technology, sustainability, and innovation are reshaping the industries, the **School of Hospitality Management at Mahindra University** positions itself as a leader to redefine hospitality education. Our mission is to produce visionary leaders and entrepreneurs who will drive the future of the global culinary and hospitality sectors while embracing the values and expectations of the next generation of learners—**Gen Z**.
The **4-Yr B.Sc. (Hons.) in Culinary & Hospitality Management** program is an innovative, future-focused curriculum designed to nurture industry leaders, entrepreneurs, and changemakers. By blending traditional hospitality principles with advanced technological insights, we prepare students to thrive in a dynamic, fast-paced global landscape.
[Apply Now](https://admission.mahindrauniversity.edu.in/)
[Download Admission Notification ](https://www.mahindrauniversity.edu.in/wp-content/uploads/2025/02/SoH-Admission-Notification-2025-26-1-2.pdf)
![Bishnu P Pal](https://www.mahindrauniversity.edu.in/wp-content/uploads/2023/02/Chef-K-Thirus.webp)
#### Chef K. Thirugnanasambantham
###### Dean, School of Hospitality Management
Chef K. Thirugnanasambantham, is a distinguished academic leader and culinary educator with over 34 years of experience in both the hospitality industry and academia. As the Founding Dean of the School of Hospitality at Mahindra University, Chef Thiru champions innovation, leadership, and excellence in culinary and hospitality education.
[Read More](https://www.mahindrauniversity.edu.in/schools/school-of-hospitality-management/)
×
####  ![S. Srinivasa Rao](https://www.mahindrauniversity.edu.in/wp-content/uploads/2023/02/Chef-K-Thirus.webp)Chef K. Thirugnanasambantham
###### Dean, School of Hospitality Management
Chef K. Thirugnanasambantham, affectionately known as Chef K. Thiru, is a distinguished academic leader and culinary educator with over 34 years of experience in both the hospitality industry and academia. As the Founding Dean of the School of Hospitality at Mahindra University, Chef Thiru champions innovation, leadership, and excellence in culinary and hospitality education.
**Academic and Professional Background**
Chef Thiru has made significant strides in academia and the hospitality industry. Before joining Mahindra University, he spent 25 years at the Welcomgroup Graduate School of Hotel Administration (WGSHA), a part of Manipal Academy of Higher Education (MAHE). His tenure included six years as Principal and four years as Vice Principal, with a focus on transforming WGSHA into one of India’s premier hospitality institutions. Chef Thiru has been on the rolls of ITC Hotels as a Senior Executive, a testament to his ongoing contributions to ITC’s hospitality endeavours, with WGSHA operating under ITC Hotels’ mentorship during his time there. He also gained early industry experience with prestigious brands like the Taj Group of Hotels, Residency Group of Hotels, and Blue Hill Food Products, providing him with eight years of operational expertise.
#### **What Sets Us Apart**
**A Future-Ready Curriculum**  
Our program integrates foundational hospitality skills with futuristic subjects such as **Hospitality Data Analytics** , **AI in Hospitality Operations** , and **Culinary Biotechnology**. These courses empower students to leverage emerging technologies, transform guest experiences, and adopt sustainable practices in their careers.
**Gen Z-Centric Classroom Engagement:** Recognizing the unique learning preferences of Gen Z, we prioritize innovative, interactive, and adaptive teaching methods to foster engagement and active participation. Some of the key initiatives include:
  * **Gamified Learning Modules:** Interactive quizzes, competitions, and scenario-based simulations make learning dynamic and immersive.
  * **Real-Time Problem Solving:** Students tackle live case studies and industry challenges to develop practical, actionable solutions.
  * **Interactive Digital Platforms:** AI-driven tools, virtual classrooms, and augmented reality applications create a personalized and hands-on learning experience.


  * **Collaborative Projects:** Group projects emphasizing peer learning and real-world applications help students sharpen teamwork and leadership skills.
  * **Purpose-Driven Education:** Connecting lessons to global challenges like sustainability and ethical business practices resonates with Gen Z’s values, fostering deeper engagement.


### **Holistic Leadership Development**
Exceptional hospitality leaders require technical expertise, entrepreneurial acumen, and ethical foresight. Courses like **From Blueprint to Business** and **Hospitality Asset Management** provide students with the tools to conceptualize, launch, and manage successful ventures. Leadership and communication training are also integrated to prepare students for influential roles.
### **Sustainability as a Core Value**
Our curriculum addresses critical global issues by integrating courses like **Food Waste Management in Culinary Practices** and **Culinary Pharmacology**. These programs emphasize eco-conscious solutions and healthier food options, ensuring our graduates lead with responsibility and innovation.
### **An Entrepreneurial Edge**
The hospitality sector is a hub for entrepreneurial opportunities. Our program focuses on nurturing this spirit through courses in **Culinary Entrepreneurship** , **Hospitality Asset Management** , and **Market Trends in Hospitality** , equipping students to create and scale successful ventures.
### **World-Class Faculty and Mentorship**
Our distinguished faculty, comprised of industry veterans and academic leaders, brings practical insights into the classroom. By blending traditional teaching with modern methods like real-world case studies, interactive platforms, and gamified modules, we meet the needs of Gen Z learners and ensure they are prepared to navigate the industry’s complexities.
### **Global Exposure and International Collaborations**
We are proud to partner with some of the most prestigious institutions globally, including **César Ritz Colleges, Swiss Hotel Management School,** and **Culinary Arts Academy, Switzerland** , along with **Virginia Tech and Conrad N. Hilton College of Global Hospitality Leadership, Houston University.**
These collaborations provide students with opportunities to gain **international exposure** through initiatives such as the **Semester Abroad Programme** and **Culinary Boot Camp** , allowing them to immerse themselves in diverse culinary traditions and hospitality practices. Students also benefit from learning directly from renowned chefs and experts at our partner institutions, gaining valuable insights into global industry standards and innovations.
### **Industry Partnerships, Experiential Learning, and World-Class Infrastructure**
Our **core industry partnership with Mahindra Holidays and Club Mahindra** provides students with unparalleled exposure to real-world operations. Through internships, live projects, and hands-on training at these esteemed hospitality brands, students gain invaluable insights into the workings of leading resorts and hospitality operations.
Additionally, our students will have opportunities to train with other leading **international and national hotels and restaurant brands** , further broadening their industry experience and understanding of global best practices.
To complement this, our **state-of-the-art infrastructure** includes cutting-edge culinary labs, simulation kitchens, sensory analysis labs, and experiential learning spaces, all designed to mirror real-world industry settings. With modern classrooms, digital learning hubs, and hospitality technology labs, students receive the best possible environment to hone their skills and develop industry-ready competencies. These world-class facilities ensure an immersive, hands-on learning experience that bridges the gap between academic theory and practical application.
### **Why Choose the School of Hospitality Management at Mahindra University?**
At the **School of Hospitality Management, Mahindra University** , we do more than educate—we empower students to lead the future of hospitality. By embracing the expectations and values of Gen Z, integrating innovative learning tools, and prioritizing Leadership and Entrepreneurship, we ensure our graduates are prepared to excel in an ever-changing global industry.
### **Join us to redefine hospitality and create a brighter, more sustainable future.**
Welcome to the School of Hospitality Management at Mahindra University—where innovation meets tradition, and the future of hospitality begins**. We nurture leaders and entrepreneurs who are ready to shape the global hospitality landscape.**

## School of Digital Media and Communication
[Overview](https://beta.mahindrauniversity.edu.in/schools/school-of-media/)
[Courses Offered](https://mahindrauniversity.edu.in/schools/school-of-media/courses-offered/)
  * ###### [About](https://www.mahindrauniversity.edu.in/schools/school-of-media/#tab-e20e71bbd9e5caebfdd)
  * ###### [Purpose](https://www.mahindrauniversity.edu.in/schools/school-of-media/#tab-c1c2424e0208a0f8e2e)
  * ###### [Vision and Mission](https://www.mahindrauniversity.edu.in/schools/school-of-media/#tab-70cb105f23a096178f7)
  * ###### [Learning process](https://www.mahindrauniversity.edu.in/schools/school-of-media/#tab-32d57a54dde6e43e8a3)
  * ###### [Methodology](https://www.mahindrauniversity.edu.in/schools/school-of-media/#tab-6996759e21eee900146)
  * ###### [Industry, global outreach](https://www.mahindrauniversity.edu.in/schools/school-of-media/#tab-1a606c02b5a648570e2)
  * ###### [Global connect](https://www.mahindrauniversity.edu.in/schools/school-of-media/#tab-31aa7bd7228f9b45387)


  * ###### [About](https://www.mahindrauniversity.edu.in/schools/school-of-media/#tab-e20e71bbd9e5caebfdd)


Mahindra University’s School of Digital Media and Communication brings to you the following opportunities for enrolment:
  * [3-year Bachelor of Journalism and Mass Communication (BJMC)](https://www.mahindrauniversity.edu.in/programs/ba-journalism-mass-communication-2/)
  * 4-year Bachelor of (Hons) Journalism and Mass Communication (BJMC Hons) based on merit from the 3-year BJMC program
  * [4-year Bachelor of Technology in Computation and Media (BTCM)](https://www.mahindrauniversity.edu.in/programs/computation-media/)
  * [MA in Journalism and Mass Communication](https://www.mahindrauniversity.edu.in/programs/ma-in-journalism-and-mass-communication/)
  * [Doctorate of Philosophy (Ph.D.) in Media and Communication](https://www.mahindrauniversity.edu.in/programs/phd-in-media-and-communication/)


It aims to prepare our graduates as righteous, responsible, competent and globally acceptable citizens of the world. It is the outcome of perceived need at the intersection of the fields and practices of mediated communication, communication technology and social change.
With a focus on creativity and innovation in the digital age and beyond. Our School of Digital Media and Communication provides a platform for aspiring media professionals to understand the role of communication in our lives. In doing so, they develop competencies in three directions—the conceptual, the practical/professional/technical, and the ethical. Our programs offer a set of courses that refreshes different in approach. Starting with an understanding of how we learn as humans, students learn how media psychology works. As a new school, we recognize the deep and wide gaps in the supply of professional graduates in today’s media and technology industries. One of the widest and deepest such gaps is in understanding how humans think, feel and work. This is one of the components of study that will make our graduates a cut above the rest.
The school provides state-of-the-art facilities including a spacious audiovisual studio floor with a production control room (PCR), an audio studio, a MoJo studio (with cyclorama), an immersive (VR-XR) studio floor, and a fully equipped editing and computing laboratory with uncompromising features. We use industry standard equipment after carefully researching and examining those standards, while also augmenting our facilities for future use. Thus, our students learn in the best possible environment while gaining various professional and technical competencies as they learn media and related practices.
Come, discover what you can do, and be surprised!
  * ###### [Purpose](https://www.mahindrauniversity.edu.in/schools/school-of-media/#tab-c1c2424e0208a0f8e2e)


Hence, the purpose of the School is to equip students with the analytical tools to confront the world of communication, in the following ways:
  * To provide an edge to our graduates through their competencies.
  * To nurture learners through real-world practices, to improve upon them, and to build an ethically sound ecosystem.
  * To use a technology-equipped and humanities-centric approach.


Our School of Digital Media and Communication was born in the academic year 2023-24 with two bachelor’s programmes. We offer a 3-year Bachelor of Journalism and Mass Communication and a 4-year Bachelor of Journalism and Mass Communication (Hons.), and a 4-year B.Tech in Computation and Media. With the application of digital technology, the media and related industries have been experiencing unprecedented growth. The introduction of mediated communication for the public at large has meant that this growth has become a mass movement among “media prosumers”—consumers who are also producers of media texts. Since everyone equipped with a smartphone is a potential media prosumer, the practice of superior mediated communication defines its contours. This is not merely a technological change but a sociological one. To that end, our Bachelor of Journalism and Mass Communication and B.Tech. programmes recognize digital technology as an inevitable and integral part of mediated communication today and in time to come.
This exciting time also presents several challenges. The ever-evolving field of mass communication now, more than ever before, needs an all-round understanding of technology and sociology, between message and its construction. This convergence of information, entertainment, opinion, promotion and distribution presents an exciting new cornucopia of activities bundled together.
There is also convergence in another way. In addition to a steady demand for professionals in the more conventional roles in news, entertainment, and the allied areas of advertising and public relations, there is an increasing demand for digital journalists, content creators and digital marketing professionals. Legacy media platforms are investing heavily on the digital side of their businesses. Other industries, too, are investing in creating or recasting media rooms in digitized forms, from which internal and external communication and corporate storytelling occurs. The ability to understand, delineate and control each of these activities distinguishes the media and communication professional from a prosumer.
To that end, our programmes integrate all that is needed in this new and evolving ecosystem to deliver academically sound, research-oriented, practically trained graduates. You will gain exposure to cutting-edge developments, both in technology and techniques of creating content and its delivery for the functions of news, entertainment, PR, advertising, corporate communication, and digital platforms.
In 2024, we have added a Ph.D. programme in Media and Communication. Master’s programmes in journalism, mass communication, and communication management will be introduced in 2025.
Enabling the practical side of learning are our three digital studios:
  1. A large floor with two sets including a production control room (PCR), a greenscreen set, a conventional set, and a conveniently styled gallery-seating space;
  2. An audio studio; and
  3. An immersive media studio floor with cyclorama and other paraphernalia for such exciting productions as music videos.


  * ###### [Vision and Mission](https://www.mahindrauniversity.edu.in/schools/school-of-media/#tab-70cb105f23a096178f7)


  * To nurture _improved practices_ of mediated communication with an aim towards better societies capable of balancing the use of communication in responsible ways.
  * To approach learning as a _methodology_ to develop future thought.
  * To prepare students to be changemakers using _competencies_.


  * ###### [Learning process](https://www.mahindrauniversity.edu.in/schools/school-of-media/#tab-32d57a54dde6e43e8a3)


At the School of Digital Media and Communication, it is our endeavour to see learning as a joint venture between the student and the institution. How a student peels an onion ring, going deeper into the funnel of learning, must be demonstrated by linking concepts to practice. Using this process, our courses are designed around student-centric learning processes and competency outcomes of three dimensions—conceptual, practical/professional, and ethical.
Through the period of a student’s journey, we will introduce a variety of learning mechanisms and tools, including classes, laboratory work, independent and field work, library, guest interactions, and self-discovery. However, the student will quickly recognize the complexities in the practice and learn to problematize practices while developing an increasingly firm grip on fundamental concepts of the functions of journalism, media production and communication management. It is this blend that makes our graduates technologically strong and ethically sound, conceptually clear and practically adept.
Exposing students to eclectic voices is an important part of their learning. Academic, institutional, and industry partnerships include reputed institutions and organizations from around the world. The student’s journey will be peppered with guest visits and demonstrations, field visits and internships. We expect the student to have fun while being serious-minded, relish hard work while not losing out on the enjoyment of life’s normal experiences.
The curriculum has been prepared with the student’s journey in focus. How does a student navigate the path to the world of practice? That is the fundamental pedagogic question we seek to answer; we believe the answer lies in taking the student through increasingly complex units of knowledge. Hence, amidst the cornucopia of coursework lie clearly focused pipelines for each strand. Faculty members are empowered at the School of Digital Media and Communication to bring their philosophies, perspectives, and content. Our institution welcomes and encourages the use of individual strengths and thought. Students will receive specific syllabi with textbooks (if any) and indications of reading material at the beginning of each course.
  * ###### [Methodology](https://www.mahindrauniversity.edu.in/schools/school-of-media/#tab-6996759e21eee900146)


We will employ the highest standards to develop and nurture qualities needed for a student to be a changemaker. The input is carefully constructed keeping in mind the demands of industries and businesses, as well as the needs of our societies, to generate a conceptually, ethically, practically and behaviourally consummate graduate who is aware of the rights, responsibilities and privileges of an educated and communicative citizen. Special emphasis will be laid on digital and emerging media technologies as we further update the institution on the basis of technological and sociological developments.  
Programme goals. The objectives of our programmes are heavily centred around the learner.
  * Competency-building. To build the competencies through academic delivery that aims to develop sophistication of thought, value of ethics, and practice of rigour.
  * Matching individual with society and industry. To have a student-centred approach that nurtures individuality by matching aptitudes and aspirations against scope and needs of media society and related industry.
  * Building communicative societies. To approach learning as grounded yet dynamic sets of guidelines towards the achievement of communicative goals of society and industry.
  * Interdisciplinarity. To relate and integrate the study of media with other disciplines especially in humanities and social sciences.
  * Onion-peel. To adopt a general-to-specific approach to learning.


Thus, competency-building is the fulcrum of the collaborative interface between the School of Digital Media and Communication and the student. The various demonstrable elements of these competencies perform a critical role not only for a student in the commitment to their role and exercise of responsible agency, but also for the institution in its commitment to the student. To us, competency is not to be defined in narrow curricular or practical success terms, but as the development of a personality that is professionally, critically, and ethically superior—thinking problem-solving researchers and professionals who can rethink paradigms and not become cookie-cutter bench-warmers.
The tripod of competencies. As a derivation from the above philosophical grounding, each of our programmes emerge as a marker, a demonstration of the following competencies—in combination—that will define and test this pursuit:
  * Conceptual competency: The academic grounding of thought in various subjects and fields upon which practice is founded.
  * Professional competency: A preliminary familiarity in simulated and live environments with practices among communication industries and communicative institutions.
  * Ethical competency: The development of a moral compass and an awareness of the need for a set of guiding principles for various forms of practices in industries and societies.


Furthermore, competency is a changemaking methodology, which goes well beyond the development of skills alone. It is the ability to adapt with a combination of acquired strengths and learnt behaviour. That is why we are convinced that the building of skills must necessarily accompany the construction of other attitudes that both enable and moderate our practices. The tripodic combination of competencies as described above is also individual. To that end, we believe it is imperative to keep our objectives student-centric and nurture individuals-in-societies—that is, individuals who are grounded in the governance of various industrial and sociocultural communities.  
Our approach is multi-pronged in the sense that the student must be prepared both in and out of classrooms. Some forms this would take would bridge traditionally disparate paradigms:
  * Professional and academically grounded programmes (neither a “trade school” nor a typical university programme, but a good combination of the two).
  * Interdisciplinary with high emphasis on research.
  * Project- and evidence-based progression in learning, creating and documenting tangible footprints of learning as the student progresses.


_Two approaches_ that can sustain the University head and shoulders above the normal fare we observe around us. There are several methodological ‘firsts’ that the University would have. A broader philosophy of approaching academics as a _student-centric endeavour_ rather than just a set of tasks for us to accomplish will go a long way in establishing the University as a pioneer in disruptive methods in higher education. This by corollary entails a student-centric vision, mission, plan, and pedagogy. How do we help a student achieve his/her professional objectives?
The approaches I have explained below are needed for the much-talked-about (yet elusive!) excellence in higher education per se. In communication, I believe they are both critical, but I suspect their relevance can easily be mapped onto other fields. As you may observe from these approaches, the pedagogy, or the “ _how_ ”, has precedence over the content, or the “ _what_ ” of higher education.
First, we ask ourselves what the end objective of a student’s tenure with us is. We may assume it is gainful employment, either in the industry or self-employment, through a combination of conceptual and field exposure, theory-application and practical output.
Second, we identify what approaches we must adopt to fulfil that objective. In short, our endeavour must be to adopt methodological approaches that facilitate a student to transform into a responsible professional with a researcher’s mind.
  * ###### [Industry, global outreach](https://www.mahindrauniversity.edu.in/schools/school-of-media/#tab-1a606c02b5a648570e2)

Mahindra University has numerous global partnerships around the world, both with top industries and with reputed universities. Mahindra University’s School of Media aims to prepare our graduates as righteous, responsible, competent and globally acceptable citizens of the world. It is the outcome of perceived need at the intersection of the fields and practices of mediated communication, communication technology and social change.
With a focus on creativity and innovation in the digital age, Mahindra University’s School of Media provides a platform for aspiring media professionals to develop their skills and knowledge, and to understand the role of communication in our lives.
The multidisciplinary approach offered is beneficial for prospective students as it allows them to explore various aspects of media and gain a broader understanding of the industry. A well designed curriculum enables students to learn skills they will require in the new media environment – be it in journalism, digital media, application of computing, or other communication disciplines.
Starting in academic year 2023-24, the School is admitting students to enroll :
  1. B.Tech. (Computation & Media) and
  2. Bachelor of Journalism and Mass Communication,


catering to different interests and career paths within the media field.
Over the next few years, the School will offer programs in functional and technical areas of communication and allied areas.
One of the key strengths of the school would its experienced faculty consisting of industry experts. Having professionals who are actively engaged in the media industry ensures that students receive up-to-date knowledge and insights. The passion of the faculty members for sharing their expertise and fostering critical thinking skills is likely to inspire and motivate students.
At Mahindra University the school of media aims to provides state-of-the-art facilities and hands-on training further enhance the learning experience and provide the exposure to up-skill themselves to gain practical knowledge in area like media production, storytelling, data science, extended reality and emerging technologies, for students to thrive rapidly in the evolving media landscape.
Overall, the School of Media at Mahindra University will strive to offer a dynamic and immersive learning environment, combining theoretical knowledge with practical training.

#### Dr. Shashidhar Nanjundaiah
###### School of Digital Media and Communication
It is my pleasure to explain what Mahindra University’s School of Digital Media and Communication stands for and why our students will find themselves at the cutting edge of what their world has to offer.
[Read More](https://www.mahindrauniversity.edu.in/schools/school-of-media/)
