## **Work of Research Scholars**
![Framework for Rich Media in Online Education](https://www.mahindrauniversity.edu.in/wp-content/uploads/2025/06/Framework-for-Rich-Media-in-Online-Education-scaled.webp)
**A Framework for Rich Media in Online Education: A Psychological, Cognitive and Emotional Study**  
Prof. Prakash Narkhede
This research explores how rich media-motion graphics, interactive multimedia, and AI tools-impact cognitive load, emotional engagement, and learning efficacy in design education. Using a practice-based approach, it examines how multimedia environments enhance retention, creativity, and the effectiveness of AI-driven feedback in online design learning.
**Developing a Framework for Teaching Stop Motion Animation using AI Tools/Agents**  
Prof. Bhanu Prakash
This research explores using AI to streamline stop-motion animation while preserving its handmade aesthetics. It develops a practice-based pedagogy for design students and investigates AI’s role in empowering Indian artisans through digital platforms. The project aims to blend tradition and technology, promoting handicrafts via innovative animation and sustainable toy alternatives.
![Developing a Framework for Teaching Stop Motion Animation using AI Tools](https://www.mahindrauniversity.edu.in/wp-content/uploads/2025/06/Developing-a-Framework-for-Teaching-Stop-Motion-Animation-using-AI-Tools-scaled.webp)
![An Investigation into Architecture Motifs in India Textiles Cultural and Aesthetic Sensibilities](https://www.mahindrauniversity.edu.in/wp-content/uploads/2025/06/An-Investigation-into-Architecture-Motifs-in-India-Textiles-Cultural-and-Aesthetic-Sensibilities-scaled.webp)
#####  **An Investigation into Architecture Motifs in India Textiles: Cultural and Aesthetic Sensibilities**  
Prof. Sayoni Laha
This research examines how architectural motifs-from Mughal jaalis to temple gopuram details-are reflected in traditional Indian textiles like Banarasi, Pochampally, and Kanchivaram. It explores the historical continuity, artistic evolution, and future relevance of these designs, highlighting the deep connections between Indian architecture and textile aesthetics in contemporary design.
**Reframing Sketching: Evolving Design Education for an AI-First Environment**  
Prof. Mandar Kale
This research explores how AI tools influence the cognitive and creative processes of Gen Z and Gen Alpha design students. Using practice-based methods and hybrid research, it aims to develop a toolkit that enhances originality, value, and satisfaction in design education amid hyperconnectivity, instant access, and AI-driven creative workflows.
![Reframing Sketching Evolving Design Education for an AI-First Environment](https://www.mahindrauniversity.edu.in/wp-content/uploads/2025/06/Reframing-Sketching-Evolving-Design-Education-for-an-AI-First-Environment.webp)
![Developing Innovation Pedagogy using AI for MOOCs](https://www.mahindrauniversity.edu.in/wp-content/uploads/2025/06/Developing-Innovation-Pedagogy-using-AI-for-MOOCs.webp)
**Developing Innovation Pedagogy using AI for MOOCs**  
Prof. Kums Kumaresan
This research explores integrating Artificial Intelligence into MOOCs to develop an innovation pedagogy that enhances learner engagement, personalization, and creativity. It aims to design adaptive, scalable, and outcome-driven learning frameworks that foster critical thinking and innovation, transforming digital education for diverse learners in the 21st-century knowledge economy.
#####  **Reframing Sketching: Evolving Design Education for an AI-First Environment**  
Prof. Mandar Kale
This research explores how AI tools influence the cognitive and creative processes of Gen Z and Gen Alpha design students. Using practice-based methods and hybrid research, it aims to develop a toolkit that enhances originality, value, and satisfaction in design education amid hyperconnectivity, instant access, and AI-driven creative workflows.
![Developing a Framework for Traditional handlooms to Adapt to Mainstream Market.](https://www.mahindrauniversity.edu.in/wp-content/uploads/2025/06/Developing-a-Framework-for-Traditional-handlooms-to-Adapt-to-Mainstream-Market-scaled.webp)
![Technological Interventions in Rural Housing](https://www.mahindrauniversity.edu.in/wp-content/uploads/2025/06/Technological-Interventions-in-Rural-Housing.webp)
**Technological Interventions in Rural Housing: A Sustainable Approach through Indigenous Knowledge Systems**  
Sai Harshita Abburi
This research examines sustainable rural housing through technological interventions grounded in Indigenous Knowledge Systems. It aims to integrate traditional building practices with modern innovations to create eco-friendly, cost-effective, and culturally appropriate housing solutions, promoting resilience, and environmental sustainability in rural development.
#####  **Architecting Public Policy Frameworks through Indian Knowledge Systems**  
Arpit Awasthi
This research applies Civilizational Design Thinking to develop adaptive public policy rooted in Indian Knowledge Systems. Integrating texts like Arthashastra with Nudge and Game Theory, it aims to align governance with India’s ethos, fostering culturally resonant, strategic, and equitable solutions for achieving the Viksit Bharat 2047 vision.
![Architecting Public Policy Frameworks through Indian Knowledge Systems](https://www.mahindrauniversity.edu.in/wp-content/uploads/2025/06/Architecting-Public-Policy-Frameworks-through-Indian-Knowledge-Systems.webp)
## **Research Work**
###  **Evaluating AI-Assisted Skill Development in Design Education:**  
A Pre-Post Analysis with Expert and AI-Based Assessment
##### **Blending AI and Expert Insight in Design Education**
As AI transforms education, this study explores its role in helping first-year design students learn the “Elements and Principles of Design.” Conducted with 31 students at School of Design Innovation in Hyderabad, India, the research aimed to understand how AI, combined with traditional teaching, can shape skill development.
Key words
Personalized learning, Scalable teaching-learning, AI-assisted Learning,  
AI-human evaluation
Authors
Bhanu Prakash Bussagari Chaitanya Solanki  
B.K. Chakravarthy Sai Harshita Abburi
#### **Methodology**
As AI transforms education, this study explores its role in helping first-year design students learn the “Elements and Principles of Design.” Conducted with 31 students at School of Design Innovation in Hyderabad, India, the research aimed to understand how AI, combined with traditional teaching, can shape skill development.
#### **Pebble Exercise & Evaluation**
Design students created dot-based artwork on palm-sized pebbles using various paints and tools, exploring color, medium, and composition in a half-day activity. Each student completed two versions-before and after receiving AI feedback. These artworks were anonymized and evaluated by three independent experts and an AI system on six parameters: theme expression, color interplay, precision, creativity, composition, and overall design.
This dual evaluation aimed to assess the impact of AI guidance on student performance, blending human insight with AI’s objective analysis.
![Evaluating AI-Assisted Skill Development in Design Education](https://www.mahindrauniversity.edu.in/wp-content/uploads/2025/06/Evaluating-AI-Assisted-Skill-Development-in-Design-Education.webp)
![Methodology](https://www.mahindrauniversity.edu.in/wp-content/uploads/2025/06/Methodology.webp)
![Pebble Exercise & Evaluation](https://www.mahindrauniversity.edu.in/wp-content/uploads/2025/06/Pebble-Exercise-Evaluation.webp)

School of Design Innovation Mahindra University
Hyderabad, India

## School of Design Innovation
Mahindra University’s School of Design Innovation is a paradigm shift in design education focusing on collaborative innovation and foundation courses spread across all schools ranging from engineering to Humanities.
Mahindra University’s School of Design Innovation has a new era in education, beginning in Fall 2024 with a Bachelor of Design program, soon to be followed by Masters and Doctoral programs.
At its core, design innovation is an effective problem-solving method that blends creativity with strategic acumen. It empowers students to address intricate challenges by discerning the user needs, crafting inventive solutions, and rigorously testing their concepts. This forward-thinking approach propels graduates to become catalysts for change, enabling them to devise groundbreaking products, services, and systems that tackle real-world issues across various industries.
[Apply Now](https://admission.mahindrauniversity.edu.in/)
[Download Brochure](https://mahindrauniversity.edu.in/wp-content/uploads/2023/04/som-broucher.pdf)

## Programs
## Offered
This program ignites the creative spark in future design professionals, nurturing their ability to translate innovative ideas into impactful products and services that shape the future.
## B.Des in Design Innovation
The bachelor’s program in design innovation is a 4-year transformative journey that blends creativity, technology, and innovation. Over four years, students develop expertise across key design disciplines, preparing for a dynamic career in the ever-evolving design industry. From foundational skills to industry-aligned capstone projects, this program is designed to inspire and equip future designers to shape the world. It empowers students with problem-solving skills to create impactful solutions, shaping the future of industries.
![Bachelor Program in Design](https://www.mahindrauniversity.edu.in/wp-content/uploads/2023/02/B.Des-in-Design-Innovation.webp)
[Learn More](https://www.mahindrauniversity.edu.in/programs/bachelors-in-design-program/)
[Apply Now](https://admission.mahindrauniversity.edu.in/)
## M.Des in Design Innovation
The Master’s program in design Innovation is a 2-year program where students will work on problems from industry.
The first year is dedicated to Design foundation learning and the final year is the year marked for Design Innovation Thesis project.
![Bachelor Program in Design](https://www.mahindrauniversity.edu.in/wp-content/uploads/2023/02/M.Des-in-Design-Innovation.webp)
[Learn More](https://www.mahindrauniversity.edu.in/programs/masters-of-design-innovation/)
[Apply Now](https://admission.mahindrauniversity.edu.in/)
## Ph.D in Design Innovation
The Ph.D. program is a practice-based program. Scholarly research is an important cornerstone that distinguishes professions from trade. Research and practice-oriented disciplines, like design, grow and remain relevant only if their professionals constantly contribute to and expand this body of knowledge.
![Bachelor Program in Design](https://www.mahindrauniversity.edu.in/wp-content/uploads/2023/02/Ph.D.-in-Design-Innovation.webp)
[Learn More](https://www.mahindrauniversity.edu.in/programs/phd-in-design-innovation/)
[Apply Now](https://admission.mahindrauniversity.edu.in/)
